description: Sum of digits of (n written in base 3).
comments: Also the fixed point of the morphism 0->{0,1,2}, 1->{1,2,3}, 2->{2,3,4}, etc. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 27 2006a(A062318(n)) = n and a(m) < n for m < A062318(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 26 2008a(n) = A138530(n,3) for n > 2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 26 2008

formula: a(0)=0, a(3n)=a(n), a(3n+1)=a(n)+1, a(3n+2)=a(n)+2. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 19 2002a(n) = A062756(n) + 2*A081603(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2003G.f.: (Sum_{k>=0} (x^(3^k)+2*x^(2*3^k))/(1+x^(3^k)+x^(2*3^k)))/(1-x). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 06 2004, corrected by _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 03 2005In general, the sum of digits of (n written in base b) has generating function (Sum_{k>=0} (Sum_{0<=i<b} i*x^(i*b^k))/(Sum_{0<=i<b} x^(i*b^k)))/(1-x). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Nov 03 2005First differences of A094345. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Nov 08 2005a(n) = n-2*sum(k>0, floor(n/3^k))=n-2*A054861(n). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Dec 19 2002a(n) <= 2*log_3(n+1). - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Jun 01 2011a(n) = Sum_k>=0 {A030341(n,k)}. - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Oct 21 2011G.f. satisfies G(x) = (x+2*x^2)/(1-x^3) + (1+x+x^2)*G(x^3), and has a natural boundary at |x|=1. - _Robert Israel_, Jul 02 2015
